title: How to Heat an Eyelash Curler

steps.title: Clean your curler using soap and water.
steps.content: Clean your curler using soap and water. Rub makeup cleanser or soap for sensitive skin on the pad and metal area of the curler with a cotton pad or sponge. Make sure there is no leftover makeup on the pad or metal parts of the curler. Rinse all of the soap and residue off with water. [1] X Research source If your curler has makeup residue on the pad before you curl the lashes, the residue can create clumps of mascara and leave you with a less-than-ideal curl.

steps.title: Use a hair dryer to heat up the curler.
steps.content: Use a hair dryer to heat up the curler. Hold the end of the curler near the hot air for 10 - 20 seconds. Use a dryer with a concentrator nozzle and keep it pointed toward the clamp. Let the curler cool down to a warm temperature so that it does not hurt to touch the metal parts. [2] X Expert Source Cassandra McClure Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 7 March 2019. Be careful when touching the metal parts of the curler. These parts absorb the most heat and can burn your skin.

steps.title: Put the curler under hot water if you don't have a dryer.
steps.content: Put the curler under hot water if you don't have a dryer. Run the eyelash curler under hot water for 10 - 20 seconds. Let it cool down to a warm and touchable temperature. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Test the heat of the curler on the back of your hand.
steps.content: Test the heat of the curler on the back of your hand. Make sure you can hold it there for at least 3 - 5 seconds without it burning. If it does burn, allow it to cool for 10 - 20 seconds before testing again. If the curler is too hot for skin, it's too hot for your lashes. Putting a curler on lashes is too hot can damage and even remove them.

steps.title: Curl your lashes.
steps.content: Curl your lashes. Gently clamp the warm curler 2-3 times on each set of lashes. Start near the lashline or band and work outward toward the tips of the lashes. This helps give a more natural look. [4] X Expert Source Cassandra McClure Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 7 March 2019. After your lashes are curled, use mascara to add depth and length.

steps.title: Clean the heated curler using rubbing alcohol.
steps.content: Clean the heated curler using rubbing alcohol. Making sure the curler is not turned on, put rubbing alcohol on a cotton swab and rub the area of the wand that touches your lashes until there is no residue. [5] X Research source Do not use water and soap on electric curlers. Running a heated curler (battery operated or electric) underwater can damage the circuitry and ruin the curler.

steps.title: Prepare the curler with necessary attachments or accessories.
steps.content: Prepare the curler with necessary attachments or accessories. If it is battery operated, look inside the cartridge to determine what kind of batteries it requires. If it's an electric curler, plug it into a nearby outlet. Most battery operated curlers use AAA batteries.

steps.title: Follow the curler’s instructions for how to turn it on.
steps.content: Follow the curler’s instructions for how to turn it on. Some curlers require you to hold down an “On” button until it reaches the heat you desire. Other curlers simply have an “On” switch you can press and do not have to continue holding down.

steps.title: Wait for the wand to cool down to a warm temperature.
steps.content: Wait for the wand to cool down to a warm temperature. Before using the curler, hold it against the skin on the back of your hand. If it is uncomfortable to leave against your skin, it is too hot to use on your lashes. Wait for 10 - 20 seconds and test again.

steps.title: Use the curler on your lashes.
steps.content: Use the curler on your lashes. Gently clamp the heated curler on the lashes 2-3 times. Work from the lashline or lash band toward the tip of the lashes. Follow the curl with mascara for more length and definition.
